Sentencas: The amount of glycine added, i.e. the glycine/oxide molar ratio, k, is optimized for the synthesizing La0.85Sr0.15MnO3-delta (LSM) powders by a glycine-nitrate process.
Titulo: Characteristics of La0.85Sr0.15MnO3-δ powders synthesized by a glycine-nitrate process

Sentencas: The specific surface area of the resultant LSM powders increased with this ratio, which indicates the deviation of the required glycine from the stoichiometric reaction.
Titulo: Characteristics of La0.85Sr0.15MnO3-δ powders synthesized by a glycine-nitrate process

Sentencas: The powder is further characterized as a precursor for LSM-SDC (samarium-doped ceria) composite electrodes for solid oxide fuel cells.
Titulo: Characteristics of La0.85Sr0.15MnO3-δ powders synthesized by a glycine-nitrate process

Sentencas: The electronic conductivity of the LSM-SDC composite increases with increases in the glycine/oxide ratio.
Titulo: Characteristics of La0.85Sr0.15MnO3-δ powders synthesized by a glycine-nitrate process

Sentencas: In addition, the ratio has an effect on the interfacial polarization resistance of the LSM-SDC electrodes, as determined wit symmetric cells using AC impedance spectroscopy.
Titulo: Characteristics of La0.85Sr0.15MnO3-δ powders synthesized by a glycine-nitrate process

Sentencas: The lowest resistance is achieved using a LSM powder prepared with 20% more glycine than the stoichiometric requirement (k = 1.2).
Titulo: Characteristics of La0.85Sr0.15MnO3-δ powders synthesized by a glycine-nitrate process

Sentencas: The activation energies for electrochemical oxygen reduction are about 1.3 eV, when the ratio is below 1.2, and about 1.0 eV, when it exceeds 1.2.
Titulo: Characteristics of La0.85Sr0.15MnO3-δ powders synthesized by a glycine-nitrate process

Sentencas: The activation energy suggests that oxygen ion transfer is the rate determining process for the LSM-SDC electrode when k >= 1.2, whereas both mass transfer and charge transfer are the rate limiting steps when k < 1.2.
Titulo: Characteristics of La0.85Sr0.15MnO3-δ powders synthesized by a glycine-nitrate process
